```{r}
# Make sure you have the tidyverse package loaded for filter() and summarise()
# If you haven't already, run: install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)
# library(dplyr) # If you prefer to load dplyr specifically

# 1. Keep only patients where 'Person Neoplasm Status' = "WITH TUMOR"
brca_with_tumor <- brca %>%
  filter(`Person Neoplasm Status` == "WITH TUMOR")

# 2. Compute the average 'Diagnosis Age' for these patients
average_diagnosis_age <- brca_with_tumor %>%
  summarise(mean_diagnosis_age = mean(`Diagnosis Age`, na.rm = TRUE))

# You can then print the result
print(average_diagnosis_age)

# Or, combine both steps into a single pipeline:
combined_result <- brca %>%
  filter(`Person Neoplasm Status` == "WITH TUMOR") %>%
  summarise(mean_diagnosis_age = mean(`Diagnosis Age`, na.rm = TRUE))

print(combined_result)
```
